com.premiumminds.webapp.wicket.testing

Class AbstractComponentTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.easymock.EasyMockSupport
      • com.premiumminds.webapp.wicket.testing.AbstractComponentTest
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.apache.wicket.util.IContextProvider<org.apache.wicket.ajax.AjaxRequestTarget,org.apache.wicket.Page>

    public abstract class AbstractComponentTest
extends org.easymock.EasyMockSupport
implements org.apache.wicket.util.IContextProvider<org.apache.wicket.ajax.AjaxRequestTarget,org.apache.wicket.Page>
    Base class for creating unit tests for wicket components. The core of the class is based on BaseWicketTester.startComponentInPage(Component), and it uses EasyMockSupport.createMockBuilder(Class) to create a mock of AjaxRequestTarget with which to verify Ajax calls from the component. Note that AjaxRequestTarget.addListener(IListener), IRequestHandler.respond(IRequestCycle) and IRequestHandler.detach(IRequestCycle) are ignored by the mock, as they are used by the wicket framework itself.

    • Field Detail

      • exception

        public org.junit.rules.ExpectedException exception
        Rule for expecting thrown exceptions during test execution. Preferred over expected= in a @Test annotation. The test should call ExpectedException.expect(Class) or a similar method to specify that it expects an exception to be thrown subsequently.

    • Method Detail

      • setUp

        public void setUp()
        Code that runs before every test. If this method is overriden, the override must call super.setUp(). The preferred alternative is to simply create a differently named method and annotate it with @Before.

      • tearDown

        public void tearDown()
        Code that runs after every test. If this method is overriden, the override must call super.tearDown(). The preferred alternative is to simply create a differently named method and annotate it with @After.

      • createApp

        protected org.apache.wicket.protocol.http.WebApplication createApp()
        Creates an instance of a Wicket WebApplication in which to run the tests. Can be overriden if specific functionality is needed in the app, such as a specific home page. Note that this method is only called once, in the test constructor.
        Returns:
        An instance of a WebApplication.

      • createTester

        protected ExtendedWicketTester createTester(org.apache.wicket.protocol.http.WebApplication app)
        Creates the Wicket tester object that will support the tests. Can be overriden if additional functionality is required in the tester, such as replacing the default page for component tests.
        Parameters:
        app - The Wicket application that the tester will associate with the pages and components created
        Returns:
        A new instance of the tester

      • startTest

        protected void startTest(org.apache.wicket.Component subject)
        Starts a component for testing in a bare-bones page generated by the wicket framework. Creates and injects a mock AJAX request target for the component to interact with. See BaseWicketTester.startComponentInPage(Component). Note that AjaxRequestTarget.addListener(IListener), IRequestHandler.respond(IRequestCycle) and IRequestHandler.detach(IRequestCycle) are ignored by the mock, as they are used by the wicket framework itself.
        Parameters:
        subject - The component to be tested

      • startFormComponentTest

        protected void startFormComponentTest(org.apache.wicket.Component subject,
                          String inputType)
        Starts a component for testing in a bare-bones form in a simple page. Creates and injects a mock AJAX request target for the component to interact with. See BaseWicketTester.startComponentInPage(Component). Note that AjaxRequestTarget.addListener(IListener), IRequestHandler.respond(IRequestCycle) and IRequestHandler.detach(IRequestCycle) are ignored by the mock, as they are used by the wicket framework itself.
        Parameters:
        subject - The component to be tested
        inputType - The HTML type of the input to associate with the component to be tested

      • startTest

        protected void startTest(org.apache.wicket.Component subject,
             boolean mockRequest)
        Starts a component for testing in a bare-bones page generated by the wicket framework. Optionally creates and injects a mock AJAX request target for the component to interact with. See BaseWicketTester.startComponentInPage(Component). Note that AjaxRequestTarget.addListener(IListener), IRequestHandler.respond(IRequestCycle) and IRequestHandler.detach(IRequestCycle) are ignored by the mock, as they are used by the wicket framework itself.
        Parameters:
        subject - The component to be tested
        mockRequest - If the parameter is true, a mock request is created. Use this to verify the component's calls into Ajax. If the parameter is false, a mock request is not created and the default request created by the wicket framework is used instead. Use this to call into the component from Ajax.

      • startFormComponentTest

        protected void startFormComponentTest(org.apache.wicket.Component subject,
                          String inputType,
                          boolean mockRequest)
        Starts a component for testing in a bare-bones form in a simple page. Optionally creates and injects a mock AJAX request target for the component to interact with. See BaseWicketTester.startComponentInPage(Component). Note that AjaxRequestTarget.addListener(IListener), IRequestHandler.respond(IRequestCycle) and IRequestHandler.detach(IRequestCycle) are ignored by the mock, as they are used by the wicket framework itself.
        Parameters:
        subject - The component to be tested
        inputType - The HTML type of the input to associate with the component to be tested
        mockRequest - If the parameter is true, a mock request is created. Use this to verify the component's calls into Ajax. If the parameter is false, a mock request is not created and the default request created by the wicket framework is used instead. Use this to call into the component from Ajax.

      • getTester

        protected ExtendedWicketTester getTester()
        Returns:
        A reference to the WicketTester object created during test set-up.

      • getTarget

        protected org.apache.wicket.ajax.AjaxRequestTarget getTarget()
                                                      throws TestNotStartedException
        Returns:
        A reference to the mock Ajax request target object created by startTest(Component), startTest(Component, boolean), startFormComponentTest(Component, String) or startFormComponentTest(Component, String, boolean). The object returned is always the mock target, regardless of whether requests are currently being mocked or not.
        Throws:
        TestNotStartedException - if this method is called before any of those methods, or if resetTest() is called.

      • mockRequest

        protected void mockRequest(boolean mockRequest)
        Optionally creates and injects a mock AJAX request target for the component to interact with. Note that AjaxRequestTarget.addListener(IListener), IRequestHandler.respond(IRequestCycle) and IRequestHandler.detach(IRequestCycle) are ignored by the mock, as they are used by the wicket framework itself.
        Parameters:
        mockRequest - If the parameter is true, a mock request is created. Use this to verify the component's calls into Ajax. If the parameter is false, a mock request is not created and the default request created by the wicket framework is used instead. Use this to call into the component from Ajax.

      • resetTest

        protected void resetTest()
        Resets the test. Useful for running multiple components in the same test method.

      • get

        public org.apache.wicket.ajax.AjaxRequestTarget get(org.apache.wicket.Page context)
        This method is a part of IContextProvider<AjaxRequestTarget, Page> implementation and is not meant to be called by user code.
        Specified by:
        get in interface org.apache.wicket.util.IContextProvider<org.apache.wicket.ajax.AjaxRequestTarget,org.apache.wicket.Page>
